FALLOUT.Definition: bad results or effects after the event

KIDNAPPING.Definition: taking him by force and keeping him prisoner

CRACKDOWN.Definition: strong action to stop or control the situation

AFTERMATH.Definition: the time and effects after the event

ROMANTICISE.Definition: make it seem better or more beautiful than it really was

BEEPING.Definition: making a short, high sound like a car horn

HORNS.Definition: devices on vehicles that make a loud sound to warn people

A STONE’S THROW AWAY.Definition: very close, a short distance away

ATRIUM.Definition: a large open space inside the building

DISCLAIMER.Definition: a warning that explains limits or responsibility

INTRIGUE.Definition: secret or mysterious stories or situations

BLURRED.Definition: not clear or easy to see or understand

GENERALISATIONS.Definition: simple statements that don’t include all details or exceptions

PHEW.Definition: expressing a strong reaction of relief

TUMULTUOUS.Definition: full of confusion, change, or disorder

PATCHWORK.Definition: a mix of many different parts or pieces

FELLOW.Definition: someone who belonged to the same group as them

STITCHED TOGETHER.Definition: joined or connected to make one thing

AGRARIAN.Definition: related to farming or the countryside

SURRENDERING TO.Definition: giving up or agreeing to stop fighting them

REMNANTS.Definition: what was left after most had gone

PARTISAN.Definition: a person who fought against the enemy, often secretly

ALIKE.Definition: in the same or a similar way

BOOMING.Definition: growing fast and doing very well

SPAGHETTI WESTERN.Definition: old cowboy films made in Italy

ILLUSTRATE.Definition: show or explain with examples or facts

STRIKES.Definition: times when workers stopped working to protest

CONTRADICTIONS.Definition: things that were opposite to each other

UNSTABLE.Definition: likely to change or fall apart

RESTLESS.Definition: unable to stay still or calm

TENSION.Definition: nervous or unfriendly feelings between people or groups

CLAIMED RESPONSIBILITY.Definition: said they were the ones who did it

ANARCHISTS.Definition: people who didn't believe in government or laws

LEAFLETS.Definition: small printed papers given to people for information

MANIFESTOS.Definition: written statements explaining the groups’ beliefs or plans

ANARCHIST.Definition: relating to people who didn't believe in government or laws

CIRCULATING.Definition: moving or being passed from person to person

INTERROGATION.Definition: long and detailed questioning by the police

MISTRUST.Definition: not believing or not having confidence in them

WITNESS.Definition: person who had seen the event

ACQUITTED.Definition: found not guilty of the crime

ATTRIBUTED TO.Definition: said to be the work of

PATTERN.Definition: a repeated way in which it was happening

MANIPULATE.Definition: control or influence cleverly or unfairly

TASKED WITH.Definition: given the job or duty to do it

OVERLAPS.Definition: parts that were shared or covered each other

TURNING A BLIND EYE.Definition: pretending not to have seen something wrong

MURKY.Definition: unclear, dark, or hard to understand

FAINTED.Definition: lost consciousness for a short time, felt dizzy

CUSTODY.Definition: the state of being kept by the police

DANGLING.Definition: holding him so that he hanged loosely

GRIP.Definition: the way they held him tightly

AUTOPSIES.Definition: medical tests done on his dead body to find the cause of death

INCONSISTENCIES.Definition: things that didn’t match or agree

CONFESSION.Definition: a statement that he was guilty

MURKIER.Definition: less clear, more confusing or suspicious

CONSPIRACIES.Definition: secret plans by groups to do something bad or illegal

PLANTING BOMBS.Definition: putting bombs in a place to explode later

CARNAGE.Definition: great destruction and killing of many people

DESTABILISING.Definition: making it weak or likely to fall apart

MARBLE.Definition: hard, smooth stone used for buildings
